intro: Eriolopha sericea, commonly known as the silky eriolopha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft appearance. Its small, tubular flowers are typically white or pale pink and are clustered in dense inflorescences. Eriolopha sericea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
